column4: You can get good themes that make it good looking in Gnome also :)
I got... no idea, it looks OSX-ish :)
for future reference, if you want to know, it's *very* easy to convert image filetypes with ImageMagick. One command.
I don't have imagemagick installed it seems. :)
you can install it from the repositories. Then, a simple command like, "convert -quality 75 picture.png picture.jpg" and it'll be very small.
not quite sure if it comes by default on Ubuntu. I guess you could try to see if you've got the convert command
Yeah, I know it... but when I want to get out a pic in a few seconds, I don't install additional software. It's not like I do screenshots every day. :)
libmagick comes by default, imagemagick is available.
Well, sure. You obviously don't have to keep installing. And yes, it would perhaps not be worth it if you were only ever using one image; hence the "for future reference".
neither can the w32codecs available for GNU/Linux, no?
got an example file? I only have xine here, I'll tell you if it works.
I don't see any "Download" text there...
